title: Change tmp filename behavior in contrib.ffmpeg to support simultaneous decodes
body_html:
Encountered ill-defined behavior when trying to decode two audio files in a single call to sess.run. Changed GetTempFilename to use mkstemps instead of getpid. Old behavior demonstrated below:

Source code

import tensorflow as tf

def load_audio(wav_fp):
  wav_bin = tf.read_file(wav_fp)
  wav = tf.contrib.ffmpeg.decode_audio(
      wav_bin,
      file_format='wav',
      samples_per_second=16000,
      channel_count=1)
  return wav

wav_fp0 = tf.placeholder(tf.string, [])
wav_fp1 = tf.placeholder(tf.string, [])

wav0 = load_audio(wav_fp0)
wav1 = load_audio(wav_fp1)

with tf.Session() as sess:
  _wav_fp0 = 'test0.wav'
  _wav_fp1 = 'test1.wav'

  _wav0, _wav1 = sess.run(
      [wav0, wav1],
      feed_dict={
        wav_fp0: _wav_fp0,
        wav_fp1: _wav_fp1})

  print _wav0.shape
  print _wav1.shape

Race condition outcome 1 (second file write completes before either decode)

body_text:
Encountered ill-defined behavior when trying to decode two audio files in a single call to sess.run. Changed GetTempFilename to use mkstemps instead of getpid. Old behavior demonstrated below:
Source code
import tensorflow as tf

def load_audio(wav_fp):
  wav_bin = tf.read_file(wav_fp)
  wav = tf.contrib.ffmpeg.decode_audio(
      wav_bin,
      file_format='wav',
      samples_per_second=16000,
      channel_count=1)
  return wav

wav_fp0 = tf.placeholder(tf.string, [])
wav_fp1 = tf.placeholder(tf.string, [])

wav0 = load_audio(wav_fp0)
wav1 = load_audio(wav_fp1)

with tf.Session() as sess:
  _wav_fp0 = 'test0.wav'
  _wav_fp1 = 'test1.wav'

  _wav0, _wav1 = sess.run(
      [wav0, wav1],
      feed_dict={
        wav_fp0: _wav_fp0,
        wav_fp1: _wav_fp1})

  print _wav0.shape
  print _wav1.shape

Aborted (core dumped)
body:
Encountered ill-defined behavior when trying to decode two audio files in a single call to `sess.run`. Changed `GetTempFilename` to use `mkstemps` instead of `getpid`. Old behavior demonstrated below:

### Source code
```python
import tensorflow as tf

def load_audio(wav_fp):
  wav_bin = tf.read_file(wav_fp)
  wav = tf.contrib.ffmpeg.decode_audio(
      wav_bin,
      file_format='wav',
      samples_per_second=16000,
      channel_count=1)
  return wav

wav_fp0 = tf.placeholder(tf.string, [])
wav_fp1 = tf.placeholder(tf.string, [])

wav0 = load_audio(wav_fp0)
wav1 = load_audio(wav_fp1)

with tf.Session() as sess:
  _wav_fp0 = 'test0.wav'
  _wav_fp1 = 'test1.wav'

  _wav0, _wav1 = sess.run(
      [wav0, wav1],
      feed_dict={
        wav_fp0: _wav_fp0,
        wav_fp1: _wav_fp1})

  print _wav0.shape
  print _wav1.shape
```

### Race condition outcome 1 (second file write completes before either decode)
